New Records: Quinton de Kock and Rassie van der Dussen made superb centuries, with van der Dussen accelerating spectacularly at the death.

David Miller came in at the end of the 40th over and still had the nerve to play himself in, scoring 13 from the first 14 balls, then 28 from the next 10 – including a huge six over midwicket off Southee a moment ago.
Key Match Events: South Africa thrashed New Zealand by 190 runs
Quinton de Kock and Rassie van der Dussen made superb centuries
David Miller's 53 off 30 deserves a hat tip
Aiden Markram ends the innings in style, just like Viv Richards in 1979, except this was the first ball he faced.
Daryl Mitchell takes a terrific boundary catch to dismiss David Miller
Lovely bowling from Tim Southee, who bowls Rassie van der Dussen with a slower off-cutter.
Pre-Game Insights: The Kiwis must chase an intimidating 358, at more than seven an over – though they made 383 in the near miss against Australia.
Post-Match Reflections: Quinton de Kock is speaking to Harsha Bhogle after the match.
I hope 357 will be good enough. If the wicket stays the same I think it will be, but looking at the previous games the wicket does get better under lights.
Miscellaneous Highlights: South Africa did it again at the death, smacking 119 from the last 10 overs and 163 from the last 15.
Quinton de Kock and Rassie van der Dussen were superb, David Miller’s 53 off 30 deserves a hat tip and to Aiden Markram faced one ball and hit it for six.
Others: The crowd’s enthusiasm for Rachin Ravindra when he came in – a real star in the making.
The Covid inquiry is an incredible breeding ground for big dick swinging bristling machismo.
